abstract: Lawrence G. McDonald, the author of “A Colossal Failure of Common Sense,” about the collapse of Lehman Brothers, discusses the financial scene two years after the financial crisis exploded in full force. .
snippet: Lawrence G. McDonald, the author of “A Colossal Failure of Common Sense,” about the collapse of Lehman Brothers, discusses the financial scene two years after the financial crisis exploded in full force. .
lead_paragraph: Lawrence G. McDonald is the author of “A Colossal Failure of Common Sense,” a firsthand account of the collapse of Lehman Brothers, and is managing director at Pangea Capital. Mr. McDonald sat down with DealBook to discuss the future of derivatives, how more securitization would help the American economy, what some bank balance sheets are hiding, and why Lehman and Bear Stearns were brought down not by their real estate investments, but by their hedges.

headline.main: A Lehman Survivor’s View of a World Upended
